title.value: Intent-aware Multi-source Contrastive Alignment for Tag-enhanced Recommendation
title.justification: This is the title as explicitly mentioned in the given research paper.
title.quote: Intent-aware Multi-source Contrastive Alignment for Tag-enhanced Recommendation

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel method that utilizes self-supervised learning to improve recommendation systems by making fine-grained alignments between user intents and auxiliary tag information.

type.justification: The paper includes experimental studies on seven benchmark datasets to demonstrate the effectiveness of their proposed method.
type.quote: Experimental studies on seven benchmark datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of IMCAT.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is improving recommendation quality using a new method.
name.quote: To reduce information overload and to satisfy the diverse needs of users, recommendation systems have emerged and are beginning to play an important role in modern society.

name.justification: The paper leverages self-supervised learning to achieve better alignment and representation in the recommendation system.
name.quote: Motivated by the success of self-supervised learning for handling multi-modality data in computer vision and natural language understanding, we propose a method to efficiently bridge the collaborative filtering (CF) signal and the auxiliary semantic information.

name.justification: IMCAT is the novel model introduced and evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: We call our proposed method Intent-aware Multi-source Contrastive Alignment for Tag-enhanced recommendation (IMCAT).

is_contributed.justification: IMCAT is proposed by the authors as a novel method in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a novel method, IMCAT, for efficiently connecting the collaborative filtering signal and auxiliary tag information.

is_executed.justification: The experimental studies likely executed models on a GPU to handle large datasets efficiently.
is_executed.quote: The total number of training epochs is set to 3,000 for all models with an early stopping design. All experiments are conducted on GPU machines (Nvidia Tesla V100 32G).

is_compared.justification: IMCAT is compared with numerous existing state-of-the-art methods on multiple datasets.
is_compared.quote: Through comparison with numerous SOTA methods on seven real-world datasets, we show that our method can achieve better performance.

referenced_paper_title.value: Intent-aware Multi-source Contrastive Alignment for Tag-enhanced Recommendation
referenced_paper_title.justification: IMCAT is introduced, evaluated, and compared in this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We call our proposed method Intent-aware Multi-source Contrastive Alignment for Tag-enhanced recommendation (IMCAT).

name.justification: HetRec-MV is one of the datasets used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: HetRec-MV is a movie recommendation dataset. It links movies in the MovieLens dataset with their corresponding Internet Movie Database (IMDb) web pages and Rotten Tomatoes movie reviews, where each movie is assigned with tags provided by users.

referenced_paper_title.value: HetRec 2011: Proceedings of the 2nd International Workshop on Information Heterogeneity and Fusion in Recommender Systems.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The HetRec-MV dataset is discussed in HetRec 2011 proceedings.
referenced_paper_title.quote: HetRec ’11: Proceedings of the 2nd International Workshop on Information Heterogeneity and Fusion in Recommender Systems.

name.justification: HetRec-FM is another dataset used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: HetRec-FM is an artist recommendation dataset obtained from Last.fm.

referenced_paper_title.value: HetRec 2011: Proceedings of the 2nd International Workshop on Information Heterogeneity and Fusion in Recommender Systems.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The HetRec-FM dataset is discussed in HetRec 2011 proceedings.
referenced_paper_title.quote: HetRec ’11: Proceedings of the 2nd International Workshop on Information Heterogeneity and Fusion in Recommender Systems.

name.justification: HetRec-Del is another dataset used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: HetRec-Del is gathered from the Delicious social bookmarking system, which contains social relations, bookmarks, and tags from users.

referenced_paper_title.value: HetRec 2011: Proceedings of the 2nd International Workshop on Information Heterogeneity and Fusion in Recommender Systems.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The HetRec-Del dataset is discussed in HetRec 2011 proceedings.
referenced_paper_title.quote: HetRec ’11: Proceedings of the 2nd International Workshop on Information Heterogeneity and Fusion in Recommender Systems.

name.justification: CiteULike-t is another dataset used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: CiteULike is collected from CiteULike and Google Scholar.

referenced_paper_title.value: Collaborative topic regression with social regularization for tag recommendation
referenced_paper_title.justification: CiteULike-dataset is collected independently by Wang et al.
referenced_paper_title.quote: CiteULike-a and CiteULike-t, both collected independently by [49]

name.justification: Last.fm-Tag is another dataset used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: Last.fm-Tag is collected from Last.fm, where the tracks are viewed as the items.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Last.fm-Tag dataset is discussed in Last.fm documentation.

name.justification: AMZBook-Tag is another dataset used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: AMZBook-Tag is a real-world online product recommendation dataset derived from the Amazon review datasets.

referenced_paper_title.value: Ups and downs: Modeling the visual evolution of fashion trends with one-class collaborative filtering
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper utilizes Amazon review datasets which are discussed in the cited work.
referenced_paper_title.quote: R. He and J. J. McAuley, Ups and downs: Modeling the visual evolution of fashion trends with one-class collaborative filtering.

name.justification: Yelp-Tag is another dataset used in the experimental evaluations.
name.quote: Yelp-Tag is adopted from the 2018 edition of the Yelp challenge.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Yelp-Tag dataset is discussed in the Yelp-Dataset-Challenge.
